get.summary: Get a list of CloudFiles that are contained in a specified folder on your cloud service specified by a path.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

post.summary: Uploads a file to your endpoint cloud service.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to be uploaded

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: If true, the file will be over written if it exists.

parameters.name: tags[]
parameters.description: The tags to apply to this file

get.summary: Retrieves a single file from your cloud service from a specified path. The file is directly streamed from the cloud storage provider through Cloud Elements, and is not buffered to disk.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

post.summary: Copy's a File to a destination location

parameters.name: pageSize

get.summary: Search the hierarchy of items for items matching a query. You can search the current user's OneDrive.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The search string used to search for items. Values may be matched across several fields including filename, metadata, and file content.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: You can use the select query string parameter to provide a comma-separated list of properties to return on Items.

parameters.name: nextPage
parameters.description: The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of properties that are used to sort the order of items in the response collection. Works for name, size, and lastModifiedDateTime fields.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: You can use the expand query string parameter to instruct the OneDrive API to expand a children collection and include those results.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a result set. The OneDrive API may have a hard limit that prevents you from asking for more items per response.

summary.x-samplevalue: Create a new contact in the CRM service. Contact creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your CRM service. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'Contact' model are those required to create a new contact.

description.x-samplevalue: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

Object.description: Fields for the object. There will be fields associated with an Object, which are not all described here.

id.description: The id of the current user.

name.description: The name of the current user.

login.description: The email of the current user.

createdDate.description: The time this user was created

modifiedDate.description: The time this user was last modified

description.x-samplevalue: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists
